alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:48PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Eckley, or 14 miles northeast of Yuma, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Yuma County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
